blockchain.description:
20vs20, 1 bullet locked in, what could posssibly go wrong

[csgo_but_decentralised.zip](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/blockchain/csgo_but_decentralised.zip)

blockchain.name: csgo_but_decentralised

crypto.description:
During your casual afternoon stroll through the jungle (as we all do), you seem to have stumbled upon some sort of abandoned shrine...
Although... somehow... I have a feeling you are going to regret approaching it...

NOTE: for the best experience, connect before reading through the challenge files ;)

NOTE 2: The files and links provided are the same. The only difference is in the styling used. The `fast` file and connection are faster, but don't have the cool styling.

NOTE 3: Flag format: `flag{PUT_FLAG_HERE}`

[wrathsweatingbuddha.py](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/crypto/wrathsweatingbuddha.py)

[wrathsweatingbuddha-fast.py](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/crypto/wrath.py)
crypto.name: wrathsweatingbuddha

misc.description:
You'll need a lot of skill and a bit of luck.

Author: Seltzerz#6678
misc.name: Blackjack

misc.description:
Welcome to UMass CTF.  We're so excited you're here we decided to give you a free flag: `UMASS{W3LC0M3_T0_TH3_C0MP}`

We hope you enjoy this years CTF!
misc.name: welcome

misc.description:
Good luck trying to ChatGPT your way out of this challenge, and enjoy what is likely the last iteration of Jeopardy!

Author: Seltzerz#6678
misc.name: JeopardyV3

Author:  Jakob#9448

rev.description:
Do you know both sapphire and ruby are corundum? The difference that makes ruby blood-red colored is the addition of Chromium.

[sapphire.exe](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/rev/sapphire.exe)

*Author: dungwinux#6636*
rev.name: sapphire

rev.name: java_jitters_v2

rev.description:
VM Challenges are getting kinda boring so here's a cpu simulator with pipelinining and caches. This will certainly make this more fun right? (:

Run challenge using:
```sh
./pipelining -l ./bin.out
```

[pipelinining.zip](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/rev/pipelinining.zip)

*Author: seal#4393*
rev.name: pipelinining

rev.description:

web.description:
Why call it JSON if I can't put my own JS there? Introducing JS-ON! Now you can share your JS with your friends to enjoy next level development!

Bot: http://bot-json.web.ctf.umasscybersec.org:9000

[app.js](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/web/app.js)

Author:  Ayman#5138
web.name: JS-ON

web.description:
The much awaited sql to the UMass Dining experience. We're back and better than ever, join our super fan contest for a chance to be crowned "The UMassDining Enjoyer"

[umassdining2.zip](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/web/umassdining2.zip)

Author:  Ayman#5138
web.name: umassdining2

web.description:
A little birdie told me that there are some unintended solutions to the challenge I worked for so long on! However I'm on a time crunch and can't put a patch myself so I let ChatGPT write me one. If your unintended (or intended) solution from the unpatched version works, enjoy a free 500 pts!

Bot: http://bot-json2.web.ctf.umasscybersec.org:9000

[app.js](https://umass-ctf-challenges.s3.amazonaws.com/web/v2/app.js)

Author: Ayman#5138
web.name: JS-ONv2
